text: this week BBC trending asked you to tell
us what big on social media where you
are we got hundreds of responses and
here's a selection couch lsat java in
delhi got in touch to tell us about the
politician arvind kejriwal trending in
india this is very unprecedented that
elected chief minister is protesting on
streets which is very divisive in the
sense that a lot of people say but
you've been voted in power so go and do
your work in office other people think
he's doing a very new kind of inclusive
politics megelli turkish in saudi arabia
told us about the trend of fake social
media accounts of members of the Saudi
royal family and religious leaders many
of you asked us to report on the annual
killing of dolphins in Taiji Cove in
Japan the campaign against the practice
trends every year and this year it was
over three times as big as high-profile
people condemned the practice american
footballer richard sherman's out first
in a post-match interview was the
subject of one and a half million tweets
once the initial wow factor Sherman's
interview wore off the conversation on
social took a really sharp turn towards
issues of race in America Sherman ended
up tweeting about this and holding a
press conference about it this is all
become a huge distraction for the NFL
ahead of their biggest game of the year
thanks to all of you who took the time
to get in touch with us if you have a
question about any of our reports drop
us a line on Twitter at BBC trending
